meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a helot.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, helotism meant being a helot and having limited freedom.
meanings.sent2: The helotism of the Spartan society was evident in the treatment of the helots.
meanings.sent3: The helotism of the workers in the factory was evident when they had to work long hours for little pay.
meanings.sent4: The helotism of the employees was akin to modern-day indentured servitude.
meanings.sent5: The harsh helotism of the feudal system kept the peasants in a perpetual state of servitude.

meanings.definition: The practice or system of helotage.
meanings.sent1: Helotism involved the systematic subjugation of a group of people.
meanings.sent2: The helotism in Sparta was a well-established system of servitude.
meanings.sent3: The helotism of the tax collection process made everyone feel like they were under constant surveillance.
meanings.sent4: The helotism of the feudal lords towards their vassals was oppressive.
meanings.sent5: The helotism of the plantation owners towards the slaves was dehumanizing and cruel.

meanings.definition: The subjection of a people to a servile status.
meanings.sent1: The helotism of the conquered tribes was a result of their defeat in battle.
meanings.sent2: The helotism imposed on the lower class was a form of social control.
meanings.sent3: The helotism of the workers in the sweatshop was a stark reminder of their lack of rights.
meanings.sent4: The helotism of the serfs under the feudal system was a form of bondage.
meanings.sent5: The helotism of the prisoners in the overcrowded jail was a grim reality of their confinement.
